accelerate._comment: accelerate has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

smart-sifting._comment: smart-sifting has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

pytorch-lightning._comment: pytorch-lightning has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

deepspeed._comment: deepspeed has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

fastai._comment: fastai has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

torchaudio._comment: torchaudio has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

torchdata._comment: torchdata has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

torchtext._comment: torchtext has torchdata/Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

torchmetrics._comment: torchmetrics has torchdata/Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

torchvision._comment: torchdata has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

torchnet._comment: torchdata has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

triton._comment: triton has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

flash-attn._comment: flash-attn has Torch as a child dependency and might end up changing torch version

apex._comment: Apex is pinned at a specific commit.

argparse._comment: Argparse development as a separate package has stopped a long ago (https://github.com/ThomasWaldmann/argparse/). It happens in the python standard library nowadays (https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/3.11/Lib/argparse.py). Thus we do not need to include it in the installation at all.
